revised_title: The Escape of Helium from Radioactive Minerals: Experimental Observations and Implications
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the leakage of helium from radioactive minerals, such as ores of uranium and thorium. They found that the rate of helium escape from these minerals was much higher than the rate of helium production through radioactive decay. This discovery helps explain why fossilized bones and other materials do not always contain as much helium as expected based on their radioactivity and geological age.
